GeneDef.label: Chromatically Sensitive
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene are chromavores and as such need slightly less food than usual as they are able to extract a small amount of energy from the chromatic compounds in the foods they eat.\n\nThey also have chromatically hypersensitive pigmentation glands which are commonly affected by ambient color.

customEffectDescriptions.li: May be affected by surrounding colors.
Will gradually become the color of any food eaten.
May gain mood bonus from eating particularly colorful food, or food that matches their favorite color.
Might gain mood negative from eating particularly bland food, or the same color of food for too long.
Can never go grey and hair color may change naturally over time.
Chromatic sensitivity cannot be removed only temporarily repressed.
